audioViewer.changeView.info: With this tool, by drawing a rectangle with your mouse cursor, you can zoom in to the part of spectrogram that you want to view and hear in more detail. If the recording contains low-frequency background noise or other sounds which obstruct identification you can use the crop recording tool to exclude them from playback.
audioViewer.iosWarning: Please note If your device has a ring/silent switch, it has to be turned on for this page to work properly.
audioViewer.loop.info: If you want the recording to play continuously, click the loop icon.
audioViewer.maxFrequencyGreaterThanMinFr: Max frequency should be greater than min frequency
audioViewer.notSupported: Web Audio API is not supported in this browser!
audioViewer.sampleRateNotSupported: Unfortunately the recording cannot be loaded because the sample rate of {{sampleRate}} kHz is not supported in this browser. Please try using a different browser.
audioViewer.setDefaultSettings.info: Resets the time buffer to 30s and turns focus frequency off.
audioViewer.targetFrequency.info: By focusing the frequency you can exclude uninformative frequencies below and above the candidate in the spectrogram and audio. If the recording contains low frequency background noise you should keep frequency focusing on.
audioViewer.timeBuffer.info: By modifying the time buffer you can adjust time window around the candidate. Increase the buffer if you wish to see and hear a longer span of the recording. Modifying the buffer simultaneously adjusts the letter's time window.
expertise.birdSongRecognitionSkillLevel1: I can hardly identify any bird species
expertise.birdSongRecognitionSkillLevel2: I can identify some of the species (regionally)
expertise.birdSongRecognitionSkillLevel3: I can identify majority of the species regionally
expertise.birdSongRecognitionSkillLevel4: I can identify majority of the species of the continent
expertise.birdSongRecognitionSkillLevels: How easily are you able to identify the vocalizations of bird species occurring in following continents?
expertise.birdwatchingActivityLevel: How actively do you engage in birdwatching?
expertise.birdwatchingActivityLevel3: I watch birds actively and regularly
expertise.birdwatchingActivityLevel4: I am a bird researcher or professional birdwatcher
expertise.cannotRecognizeAnyBirds: Are you sure you can't recognize any bird sounds from any continent?
expertise.error: Saving failed! Please try again after some time.
expertise.missingAnswer: Please fill all fields before saving
expertise.title: Declare your level of expertise
feedback.failure: Unfortunately your feedback could not be send. You can try again in a while. If the problem continues, you can send your feedback directly to address helpdesk@laji.fi
feedback.intro: You email address is automatically included in this message since you are logged in. If you want to send anonymous feedback, please log out first.
feedback.intro.notLogged: If you want to have a response to your feedback, please give your email address.
feedback.invalid: You need to fill both Description and Message.
home.main-page.title: Finnish Biodiversity Information Facility
identification.allRecordingsAnnotated: You have identified all the recordings in this site! Thank you very much for your valuable input and improving automated bird sound identification!
identification.allRecordingsAnnotatedFor: You have identified all the recordings for this species! Thank you very much for your valuable input and improving automated bird sound identification!
identification.backToSiteSelection: Go back to the site selection
identification.backToSpeciesSelection: Go back to the species selection
identification.boxes.info: It's recommended to label sounds with boxes if it is easy i.e. recording has clear vocalizations. It is not mandatory. Don't get stuck with labelling all distant or overlapping sounds.
identification.boxes.soundType.info: If possible, define sound type. "Song/display" includes songs of songbirds and corresponding territorial/display vocalizations of adult birds, such as drumming of woodpeckers, winnowing of snipes, etc. "Other" includes other vocalization types such as flight, warning and contact calls, begging calls of juvenile birds, wing sound, etc. If this categorization is not applicable, sound type does not need to be determined.
identification.containsBatsNotOnList: Recording contains bats that are not on the list
identification.containsBatsNotOnList.inf: Free-text field for species that are not found in the taxonomy list.
identification.containsBirdsNotOnList: Recording contains birds that are not on the list
identification.containsBirdsNotOnList.in: Free-text field for species that are not found in the 2019 eBird/Clements taxonomy list. For example Maghreb Owl (<i>Strix [aluco] mauritanica<i>).
identification.containsHumanSpeech: Recording contains human speech or other vocalizations
identification.containsHumanSpeech.info: Select this if the recording includes human speech or other vocalization.
identification.containsInsectsNotOnList: Recording contains insects that are not on the list
Free-text field for species that are not found in the taxonomy list.
identification.containsUnknownBats: Recording contains bat vocalizations I cannot identify
identification.containsUnknownBats.info: Select this if there are bat vocalizations you cannot identify. If you included these sounds as possibly occurring in the list below, leave this unselected.
identification.containsUnknownBirds: Recording contains bird vocalizations I cannot identify
identification.containsUnknownBirds.info: Select this if there are bird vocalizations you cannot identify. If you included these sounds as possibly occurring in the list below, leave this unselected.
identification.containsUnknownInsects: Recording contains insect vocalizations I cannot identify
identification.containsUnknownInsects.in: Select this if there are insect vocalizations you cannot identify. If you included these sounds as possibly occurring in the list below, leave this unselected.
identification.createTemplates.info: Optionally you can view or create templates for this species by clicking this link.
identification.doesNotContainBats: No bat sounds audible in the recording
identification.doesNotContainBats.info: In case you cannot hear any bat vocalization in the recording, select this box.
identification.doesNotContainBirds: No bird sounds audible in the recording
identification.doesNotContainBirds.info: In case you cannot hear any bird vocalization in the recording, select this box.
identification.doesNotContainInsects: No insect sounds audible in the recording
identification.doesNotContainInsects.inf: In case you cannot hear any insect vocalization in the recording, select this box.
identification.drawABox: Draw a box to the spectrogram
identification.drawNonBat: Draw a box to the spectrogram that contains a non-bat sound
identification.drawNonBat.info: With this tool, by drawing a rectangle with a mouse cursor, you can annotate clear non-bat sounds such as mammals, frogs etc. This teaches the identification model to filter out non-bat sounds.
identification.drawNonBird: Draw a box to the spectrogram that contains a non-bird sound
identification.drawNonBird.info: With this tool, by drawing a rectangle with a mouse cursor, you can annotate clear non-bird sounds such as mammals, frogs etc. This teaches the identification model to filter out non-bird sounds.
identification.drawNonInsect: Draw a box to the spectrogram that contains a non-insect sound
identification.drawNonInsect.info: With this tool, by drawing a rectangle with a mouse cursor, you can annotate clear non-insect sounds such as mammals, frogs etc. This teaches the identification model to filter out non-insect sounds.
identification.filter.title: Filter recordings
identification.genericError: Unfortunately an unexpected error occurred. Please wait a while and try again in a little while.
identification.hasBoxesForAllBatSounds: I have drawn boxes for all bat sounds for the clip
identification.hasBoxesForAllBirdSounds: I have drawn boxes for all bird sounds for the clip
identification.hasBoxesForAllInsectSound: I have drawn boxes for all insect sounds for the clip
identification.highFrequencies.info: Scale the spectrogram to show higher frequencies up to 16 kHz.
identification.identify: Identify species occurring in the recording
identification.identify.info: Listen to the 10 second sound recording and enter all the bird species you can identify. Indicate, by selecting the appropriate check boxes, if the recording is of such low quality that it impairs identification, if you can hear human voices in the recording, if you have drawn boxes for all bird sounds for the clip, if there are no birds vocalizing, or if there is a bird you cannot identify. When you have completed these tasks, click "Save and move to the next recording".
identification.isLowQuality: Recording is of poor quality (disturbing noise, rain etc.)
identification.isLowQuality.info: Select this if there are rain, wind or other sources of noise which considerably hampers the listening and identification.
identification.leaveConfirm: Are you sure you want to leave and discard the unsaved changes?
identification.listBatSpecies: Insert bat species occurring in the recording:
identification.listBirdSpecies: Insert bird species occurring in the recording:
identification.listInsectSpecies: Insert insect species occurring in the recording:
identification.listSpecies.info: Insert the species you identified to the list below. In case you are reasonably uncertain of the identifications, choose "Occurs possibly" from the list below, otherwise keep the selection at "Occurs certainly" if you are reasonably sure about the identification.
identification.lowFrequencies.info: Scale the spectrogram to show lower frequencies from 0 kHz.
identification.nextBatRecording.info: Once you are ready with the identifications, and recording classifications, you are free to move to the next recording. Annotate at least the species you can identify, but also select the appropriate check boxes if the recording contains bat vocalizations you cannot identify or no bat vocalization at all.
identification.nextBatRecording.validati: Insert at least one bat species or select either "Recording is of low quality (disturbing noise, rain etc.)", "No bat sounds audible in the recording" or "Recording includes bat vocalizations I cannot identify".
identification.nextBirdRecording.info: Once you are ready with the identifications, and recording classifications, you are free to move to the next recording. Annotate at least the species you can identify, but also select the appropriate check boxes if the recording contains bird vocalizations you cannot identify or no bird vocalization at all.
identification.nextBirdRecording.validat: Insert at least one bird species or select either "Recording is of low quality (disturbing noise, rain etc.)", "No bird sounds audible in the recording" or "Recording includes bird vocalizations I cannot identify".
identification.nextInsectRecording.info: Once you are ready with the identifications, and recording classifications, you are free to move to the next recording. Annotate at least the species you can identify, but also select the appropriate check boxes if the recording contains insect vocalizations you cannot identify or no insect vocalization at all.
identification.nextInsectRecording.valid: Insert at least one insect species or select either "Recording is of low quality (disturbing noise, rain etc.)", "No insect sounds audible in the recording" or "Recording includes insect vocalizations I cannot identify".
identification.nextRecording: Save and move to the next recording
identification.possiblyOccurs.info: Select this if you are unsure about any of the bird species vocalizations in the recording. Moreover insert all the confusion species to the list, and select occurs possibly on all of them. For example, if you are unsure of the identification of a Crossbill species, you should insert Red Crossbill (Loxia curvirostra) and Parrot Crossbill (L. pytyopsittacus) and select the button occurs possibly on both of them.
identification.possiblyOccursInsect.info: Select this if you are unsure about any of the insect species vocalizations in the recording. Moreover insert all the confusion species to the list, and select occurs possibly on all of them. For example, if you are unsure of the identification of a Crossbill species, you should insert Red Crossbill (Loxia curvirostra) and Parrot Crossbill (L. pytyopsittacus) and select the button occurs possibly on both of them.
identification.previousRecording.info: If you accidentally continue to the next recording or realise that you forgot to include an identification, you can go back and amend your identifications by clicking this.
identification.saveRecording.info: If you need to stop before you are done click the save button. By doing so, the identifications you have made for the current recording are saved and the next time you return to Bird Sounds Global.
identification.skipConfirm: Are you sure you want to skip this recording and discard all the changes?
identification.taxonExpertiseMissing: Please complete the section Declare your level of expertise before continuing.
identification.timeBuffer.info: Add a time buffer to the beginning and to the end of the spectrogram.
identification.title: Annotate Soundscapes
results.pie.title: Number of validations per species
results.speciesTable.title: Species list
results.title: Results
results.userTable.name: Name
results.userTable.title: Participating experts
selfUrl.introEnd: Here you can manage the user names from other systems, etc.
selfUrl.introStart: Viewing and editing user account information requires you to log in again for security reasons. After clicking the My Account button below, please log in again.
siteSelection.description: Select sites by clicking a point in the map or by drawing an area with a draw tool. The exact location of the recording sites are not shown (10km2 grid cell level).
siteSelection.site.name: Name
siteSelection.title: Select a recording site
speciesList.hasModifications: There are species which have been modified after your validation
speciesList.hasModifications.info: Species has been modified after your validation
speciesList.hasNotPossibleValidations.in: Creating all templates for this species has been reported as not possible
speciesList.isLocked.info: Species is locked for another user
speciesList.title: Validate species templates
speciesSelection.description: Select one or more species by clicking a row in the table.
speciesSelection.title: Select a species
validation.candidates.description: Candidates for templates and their original audio files are presented here. From this view you can briefly see the available material for templates. The templates are shown as orange frames and candidates as blue frames. Click once on any of the images below to listen them through and double-click to create a template for the species. Double-clicking the audio file opens in up focused to the spot where you double-clicked it, if the audio file is longer than two minutes. Please note that the candidates are chosen by an algorithm and they may include other than the focal species. Therefore their usefulness may vary from species to another.
validation.candidates.description.oldVer: Candidates for templates and their original audio files are presented here. From this view you can briefly see the available material for templates. The templates are shown as orange frames and candidates as blue frames.
validation.description: Use the template candidates or audio files provided below to create new templates. Double-clicking any of them will open a new tab where you can reframe and confirm them as templates.
validation.description.confirm: Listen through the templates by clicking them once. If modifications are needed you can reframe and remove the existing templates by double clicking them. This will open them into a new tab. You can confirm the templates all at once by clicking the blue button below or one-by-one by double clicking and confirming them separately.
validation.description.oldVersion: This is a previous version of the candidates to which another user has made modifications. You can study the candidates by double-clicking them. You can listen to templates by clicking the them once. Modifications are not possible as this can be done only in the latest version of the species. Latest version can be accessed from the top-right corner. Templates which have been modified after this version are shown in yellow (reframed) or red (removed). Double-clicking these, you will see the explanation for these given by the user who made the modifications.
validation.leaveConfirm: Are you sure you want to leave?
validation.maxNbrOfTemplates: There are already 10 templates. Please remove one before creating a new one.
validation.missingTemplates: Please fill all 10 templates or check "Creating all templates is not possible" if it is not possible
validation.noLock: This species is being modified by another user.
validation.saveAndReturn: Save and return to species list
validation.saveAsNotPossible: Creating all templates is not possible
validation.savingError.speciesLocked: Species is locked for another user.
validation.template.audio.description: This window allows you to browse through the audio from where the template/candidate originates. Should you reframe the template, click the blue button below and draw the frame of a new template. You can study the audio closer by changing the time buffer, focus frequency and by cropping it.
validation.template.confirmAndComment: Are you sure you want to reframe / remove the template? If so, provide an explanation for this in the comment field below. This will remove all the previous validations of the template.
validation.template.description: In this window you’ll see the current framing of the template. Click ”confirm” to save the candidate as a template or to validate the template.
validation.template.remove.confirm: Are you sure you want to remove this template?
validation.title: Validate Species Templates
